description: Top copper suppliers say that their exports do not threaten U.S. national security, as the Trump administration considers tariffs.

title: Poilievre Says No Time Frame for Defunding CBC but Pledge Remains

description: Ontario Premier Doug Ford’s throne speech focused on the government’s plan to boost the province’s economy, expand infrastructure, and improve health care. The government said its first priority is to break down trade barriers with other provinces and become less […]

description: As full moons go, next month’s will be beyond the ordinary. The so-called Full Pink Moon in May, named after the month’s blooms, will appear to have shrunk to a miniature size and dimmed noticeably darker, and will also block out the red star Antares—the “heart of the scorpion” in Scorpius. Peaking on May 12 […]
title: ‘Full Flower Moon’ in May Will Be a Micro Moon—What It Means and What to Expect

description: Commentary When something’s been broken for decades and you’re dead-set on fixing it, what should you do? Try one thing, watch it fail, then try it again… and again… and again? Or look to someone else who has already dealt with the problem you’re facing and copy what they’re doing? Finally, a Canadian premier is […]
title: Alberta’s New ‘Activity-Based’ Health-Care Funding Is a Game Changer

description: NTD’s Lee Hall sits down with Michael Kill, CEO of the Night Time Industries Association. Kill says Britain’s night-time industries face existential issues as many people can no longer afford to go out. The UK’s nightlife industry employs more than 2 million people and boasts a turnover of more than 150 billion pounds (US$197 billion), […]
title: Britain’s Nightlife Crisis Damaging Employment, the Economy, and Our Culture: Michael Kill

description: Honda Canada says a media report suggesting the automaker may transfer some of its production from Canada to the United States is inaccurate. description: Bloc Québécois Leader Yves-François Blanchet and NDP Leader Jagmeet Singh are expressing concerns that the Montreal Canadiens’ final game of the season could impact viewership of the French-language leaders’ debate and are calling for the debate to be rescheduled. description: Commentary This week I want to take a poll on what you think your neighbours think about taking polls about polling. description: More than 60 percent of Canadians say Western separatism is a subject that should be taken seriously, but an equal number say the topic should not be on the table during a federal election. description: Statistics Canada says total manufacturing sales rose to their highest level since September 2023 as they climbed 0.2 percent to $72.9 billion in February. description: Canada Mortgage and Housing Corp. says the annual pace of housing starts in March slowed compared with February. The national housing agency says the seasonally adjusted annual rate of housing starts came in at 214,155 units in March, down from 221,405 in February. The change came as the annual pace of starts in centres with […]
title: CMHC Reports Annual Pace of Housing Starts Slowed in March

description: OTTAWA—Canada’s annual inflation in March surprisingly slowed to 2.3 percent, three notches below the prior month, largely helped by lower gasoline and travel tour prices, data showed on Tuesday. The core measures of inflation, which are closely tracked by the Bank of Canada, however, stayed elevated, Statistics Canada said. On a month-on-month basis, inflation rose […]
